sentences: Meng Jia (Chinese: 孟佳; pinyin:
Mèng Jia), simply known as Jia, is a Chinese singer and actress.
She was a member of South Korean girl group Miss A until her contract expired in May 2016.
Following the departure, Meng Jia signed with Banana Culture Music in 2016 to pursue her solo activities in China.
Life and career ==

section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Meng Jia was born on February 3, 1989, as the only child of her family.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She attended school in Beijing, where she was recruited by JYP Entertainment in 2007.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She later attended Seoul Institute of the Arts.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She was a former member of the project group and Chinese version of the Wonder Girls 'Sisters', but cancelled due to member and trainee changes within their company.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

== Life and career == | === 2010–2016: Debut with Miss A and first solo appearances ===

sentences: In 2010, Jia was chosen as a member of the group Miss A. The 4-member girl group debuted on July 1, 2010.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2016: Debut with Miss A and first solo appearances ===

sentences: In 2011, Jia appeared in the music video for M&D's debut single "Close Ur Mouth", and also made several cameo appearances in Dream High and Dream
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2016: Debut with Miss A and first solo appearances ===

sentences: High 2.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2016: Debut with Miss A and first solo appearances ===

sentences: In 2012, during Miss A's long hiatus after their promotions for their single "I Don't Need a Man", Jia attended several fashion shows and appeared in a number of fashion magazines.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2016: Debut with Miss A and first solo appearances ===

sentences: She also performed onstage with singer Ivy during her promotions for the single "I Dance", and participated in Let's Go Dream Team 2's special in Vietnam.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2016: Debut with Miss A and first solo appearances ===

sentences: Between 2013 and 2015, she was a presenter on MBC's C-Radio radio show with Fei and Super Junior's Zhou Mi.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2016: Debut with Miss A and first solo appearances ===

sentences: She made her acting debut in the 2014 Chinese television series One and a Half Summer alongside 2PM's Nichkhun, and went on to star in the 2015 Chinese film The Third Way of Love, which also featured performances by Song Seung-heon and Liu Yifei.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2016: Debut with Miss A and first solo appearances ===

sentences: Jia's last album with Miss A was Colors, released on March 30, 2015.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2016: Debut with Miss A and first solo appearances ===

sentences: She left Miss A and JYP Entertainment in May 2016 after deciding not to renew her contract with the company.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2016: Debut with Miss A and first solo appearances ===

== Life and career == | === 2016–present: Departure from JYP Entertainment and solo debut ===

sentences: On June 8, 2016, Jia signed a contract with Banana Culture Music at Andaz Xintiandi in Shanghai to pursue a solo career in her native China.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016–present: Departure from JYP Entertainment and solo debut ===

sentences: On November 18, Jia released her first solo single, "Drip".
section: == Life and career == | === 2016–present: Departure from JYP Entertainment and solo debut ===

sentences: It was followed by "Who's That Girl" on January 3, 2017, which charted at #6 on Billboard China.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016–present: Departure from JYP Entertainment and solo debut ===

sentences: On April 7, she released "Candy".
section: == Life and career == | === 2016–present: Departure from JYP Entertainment and solo debut ===

sentences: On April 8, 2017, Jia won the "Breakthrough Female Artist of the Year" award at the 5th Annual V Chart Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016–present: Departure from JYP Entertainment and solo debut ===

sentences: On December 19, she released her fourth single, "Mood", in collaboration with Jackson Wang from Got7.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016–present: Departure from JYP Entertainment and solo debut ===

sentences: On March 20, 2018, she returned with her fifth single, "Weapon".
section: == Life and career == | === 2016–present: Departure from JYP Entertainment and solo debut ===

sentences: Jia released her sixth single, "Free", on June 4, 2018.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016–present: Departure from JYP Entertainment and solo debut ===

sentences: Jia announced seventh single "Liwai" on September 2018.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016–present: Departure from JYP Entertainment and solo debut ===

sentences: In 2019, she left Banana Culture Entertainment and continued her solo activities.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016–present: Departure from JYP Entertainment and solo debut ===

sentences: In 2020, she and former band mate Fei joined Sisters Who Makes Waves.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016–present: Departure from JYP Entertainment and solo debut ===

sentences: She debuted as one of the member of X-Sister in the programme.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016–present: Departure from JYP Entertainment and solo debut ===

sentences: In January 2021, she released her single, "Glass Wall".
